abstract.p: We prove that, for all d ≥ 4, there are Salem numbers of degree 2d and trace -1, and that the number of such Salem numbers is ≫ d/ (log log d)<sup>2</sup>. As a consequence, it follows that the number of totally positive algebraic integers of degree d and trace 2d - 1 is also ≫ d/ (log log d)<sup>2</sup>.
